title: Installation issue: nlopt - package.py thinks it is CMake, but is actually AutoTools
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install nlopt 
  >> 3    CMake Error: The source directory "..../var/spack/stage/nlopt-2.4.2-roeg2gnpas2acdguelja6pfuali2i5hp/nlopt-2.4.2" does not appear to contain CMakeLists.txt.
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux athena52 4.4.132-94.33-default #1 SMP Tue May 29 20:09:56 UTC 2018 (76aae3b) x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
``` 
### Additional information

I am very puzzled. Spack is reporting that there is no CMakeLists.txt in the tar.gz for this package. It is quite correct, there is not. However, nlopt/package.py is very clear that this is a CMakePackage. The contents of the tar.gz indicate that it is actually an AutoTools package. 

The checksum for the tar.gz is identical to the one given in the package.py, so I am clearly working with the same file as the original author of the package.py, but I can't see how it could ever have worked. 

I thought I had better ask, rather than dive in and break things, in case I have missed something fundamental.
